div.p:
I return the
letter on the Falls
with thanks. I had
got all the ideas
down from
memory but
am glad to see
it again. I
never was favoured
with an introduction
to Norris.

I was invited by
Dr Lloyd to Dublin
and if I go am to
stay with Sir -
Magregor I think
but it is doubtful
if I be in the
country then.

Can you oblige me
by sending my
Daguerrotypedaguerreotype to
Brand- he will
forward it to Miss
Moysey who is
Gabriel's cousin.

Moffat who made
the map is the son
of the Mr Moffat whose
journal is published
in yours. He has
a turn for geography
and will be much
pleased with your
notice of him.
He sent the map to
you (the original one)
that you might
see the aid he had
rendered to Hall &
Arrowsmith without
ever being acknowledged.
He will be delighted by
your mention of
him. Before this
map came I knew
that it had been
used by Hall &
enquired about
it of Arrowsmith
with a view to
incorporate it
in that of the book.
Arrowsmith knew
of it and I have the
impression he has
a copy of it. He
said some difficulty
had occurred with
Hall & himself about
it. I understood
that the map was
to be incorporated
& acknowledged
as Moffat' s - and
when the original
came took it to you
the very next morning
after its arrival
as directed. I suppose
Arrowsmith imagines
this is different
from what he
copied. Why won't
he apply to the council
like a man?

I am ashamed at
not having written
Denman and telling
of my change of residence.
I ought to have said
that Arrowsmith
makes a general
map of all Africa
& a special one
for the book.
I suppose he intends
to incorporate
Moffat's in the
general one.
I shall write Sr Roderick

How should I refer
to Adl Smith?-
What is his proper
name & titles? -
He interested himself
about the watch
What else?
